projects.title: Booboo
projects.description: Logistics and transportation web operator where I worked as a backend developer. My responsibilities included API maintenance, code refactoring, architectural design, and performance optimization. I also performed tasks related to testing and quality assurance.

projects.title: Esteras Perrote
projects.description: Business website for an architectural firm. This project was built using PHP to develop a custom WordPress theme.

projects.title: Refri Manager
projects.description: Stock manager for ice cream shops, allowing you to control and create orders. This has been a great challenge, putting my knowledge of frontend, backend, databases, and design to work. A project developed entirely with the MERN stack.

projects.title: Rastrea Patitas
projects.description: A web application that seeks to connect lost pets with their owners. I was a backend developer, using Node.js, Express, and MongoDB. This was my second challenge in the NoCountry simulation environment.

projects.title: ServiciosClub
projects.description: Home services market. This project is the result of a group project conducted within the framework of NoCountry's work simulations. In this case, I worked as a backend developer and deepened both my technical and soft skills, including a Scrum-style work methodology.

projects.title: Andreassi
projects.description: Dynamic portfolio for a design client. This was my first work experience, where I built a fully dynamic web application that allows users to manage their own content.

projects.title: Matete
projects.description: E-commerce for mate equipment. Final training project in Backend Programming. Basic visual design, featuring a solid foundation in API response, security management, design patterns, user sessions, and error handling.

projects.title: AudioStore
projects.description: Virtual marketplace for sound elements. The emphasis of this project is on its visual aspect and user experience.
